Description: Rim to base fragment of small pottery conical cup, coarse clay with organic inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University of Pennsylvania Museum of Archaeology and Anthropology, Philadelphia. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

marked in pencil on inside 'E.S. 272' (?); also marked in ink E 242, crossed out. According the Philadelphia register card, the original number of this object was possibly 242. The register card in Philadelphia moreover describes E89 as 'fragment of jar', but does not give any further information or measurements; the register book describes E 89 as a "cynoceaphalus - sacred to Shoth". It is therefore questionable whether this is really the correct object for this registration number.
Cf. Spencer 1993, Excavations at El-Ashmunein III: The Town, pl. 56, type B.2.9.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (IB.044)
